Context:
Program Name: English As A Second Language (ESL)
Code: R901
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Part-time
Duration: Must complete the program within three consecutive academic years.
Starting Months: January, March, May, July, September, November
Location: St. James Campus
Centre: Preparative & Liberal Studies
School: English as a Second Language ESL
Program Type: Non-credit
Levels of Instruction: 8 (ranging from low beginner to advanced)
Availability: Fall, Winter, Spring (Continuous Open Enrollment for all, not Study Permit Eligible)
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/English as a Second Language (ESL) Program R901 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
ESL (Part-Time) Certificate Program:
- Hybrid program delivered both online and in-person
- Delivery mode alternates between one week in-person and one week of combined instruction
- Consists of independent weekly studies and in-class assessments
- Each level lasts six weeks and includes 50 hours of teaching/learning
- Offers a variety of elective courses
- Does not count as credit toward other George Brown programs
- Recognized by the full-time English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program
- Students can choose elective courses such as IELTS/CELPIP test preparation, effective communication, and conversation skills (additional fees apply)
- In-class assessments include quizzes, tests, oral presentations, and written assignments
- Access to online learning resources and academic resources offered by George Brown's Tutoring and Learning Centre
- Free tutoring and peer-led workshops facilitated by the Student Success Team
- Taught at George Brown's School of English as a Second Language located at 341 King Street East (Building H, St. James Campus)
- Online classes are delivered live through Zoom
- Students need access to a computer with an Internet connection, a working camera, and a microphone
- Independent weekly studies are guided by an instructor and completed asynchronously

Student Supports:
- Regular feedback and support from the instructor
- Access to the instructor through email, chat, and private messaging
- Customized online learning resources
- Academic resources offered by George Brown's Tutoring and Learning Centre
- Free tutoring and peer-led workshops facilitated by the Student Success Team.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/English as a Second Language (ESL) Program R901 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program: Business Communication
Starting Year: Fall 2023
Total cost for one course: $371.00 (domestic and international students)
Admission Requirements:
- New students must take the level placement test.
- Completion of at least five ESL courses at George Brown College, including ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED).
Placement Test Registration: Continuing Education (part–time) ESL Program Placement Test Registration
Note: Fees and requirements are subject to change.

Context:
To apply for placement tests in George Brown College, domestic and international students are required to register directly in their respective courses through the Courses section on the website. International students of R901 program do not need to apply through the Online Application System.

Contact information:
- Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or 1-800-265-2002
- English for Academic Purposes office: 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or conedesl@georgebrown.ca

Virtual tour and campus visit options are available on the website. To earn credits toward a full-time George Brown program, consider enrolling in the English for Academic Purposes programs:
- Domestic Students: R105
- International Students: R115

Website visitors can sign up to receive tailored resources and learn more about the application process and life at George Brown College.
